Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The flagship Numerical Weather Prediction model developed and used at the Met Office, is the Unified Model, the same model is used for both weather and climate prediction. For weather forecasting the Met Office runs several configurations of the Unified Model as part of its operational Numerical Weather Prediction suite. Uncovering 2 years' worth of historical data, updated regularly with a time delay. The UK deterministic model is a post processed regional downscaled configuration of the Unified Model, covering the UK and Ireland, with a resolution of approximately 0.018 degrees. The United Kingdom domain is a 1,096km x 1,408km (2km resolution grid). Formatted via NetCDF. Please note this is a public beta and therefore a non-operational service.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
https://registry.opendata.aws/met-office-uk-deterministic/

aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://met-office-atmospheric-model-data/   621.2 TiB

The Met Office's UK Deterministic (UKV) 2 km dataset, part of the Amazon Sustainability Data Initiative (ASDI), offers a rolling two-year archive of historical weather forecast data derived from the Unified Model's numerical weather prediction system. This public beta service provides post-processed, regional downscaled outputs covering the UK and Ireland at approximately 2 km resolution, encompassing variables such as air temperature, near-surface relative humidity, and other atmospheric parameters in NetCDF format. Hosted openly on AWS S3 (bucket: s3://met-office-atmospheric-model-data/, region: eu-west-2) with no access restrictions, the archive totals around 621.2 TiB and supports seamless retrieval via commands like aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://met-office-atmospheric-model-data/. Updates occur regularly, featuring hourly forecasts up to T+48 hours (issued eight times daily) and three-hourly extensions to T+120 hours, fostering free and unrestricted use for research and applications under a Creative Commons BY-SA licence. For further details on Met Office external data channels, including integrations with platforms like Snowflake and Esri UK
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
1.Download data from AWS S3 (s3://met-office-atmospheric-model-data/) and transfer it to the data centre.  
2.Use go-graphsplit to divide the retrieved files into separate CAR files.  
3.Deliver the CAR files to the SPs by means of physical hard drive shipment or HTTP download.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, North America, Greater China
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: HTTP or FTP server, Shipping hard drives
